Umineko Project (UP): ......Battler did nothing but gaze lazily out the window.
Steam (ST): ...Battler did nothing but gaze blankly out the window.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……戦人は、ぼんやりと窓の外を見ているだけだった。
Russian (RU): ......Баттлер ничего не делал — только лениво смотрел в окно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Battler não fez nada mais além de ficar preguiçosamente observando pela janela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……戰人茫然地望著窗外，一動不動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……战人茫然地望着窗外，一动不动。

Umineko Project (UP): The fighting between the relatives continued without end......
Steam (ST): The fighting between the relatives went on without end...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The fighting between the relatives continued without end......
PC Japanese (JP): 親族たちの罵り合いは、いつ果てるともなく続いている……。
Russian (RU): Спору между родственниками не было конца......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A briga entre os parentes continuou sem data para acabar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 親族們的對罵沒完沒了地還在繼續……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 亲族们的对骂没完没了地还在继续……。

Umineko Project (UP): At first, the relatives had crowded around the study.
Steam (ST): At first, the relatives had crowded around the study.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, the relatives had crowded around the study.
PC Japanese (JP): 最初、親族たちは書斎へ押し掛けた。
Russian (RU): Первым делом все столпились у кабинета.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Primeiro, eles se reuniram na frente do estúdio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 起初，親族們是一齊擁到了書房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 起初，亲族们是一齐拥到了书房。

Umineko Project (UP): However, no matter how much they knocked, the master of the study did not answer even once.
Steam (ST): However, no matter how much they knocked, the master of the study did not answer even once.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, no matter how much they knocked, the master of the study did not answer even once.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、いくらノックしても、書斎の主が応えてくれることはなかった。
Russian (RU): Но, сколько бы они ни стучали, его хозяин ни разу не откликнулся.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, não importou o quanto batessem, o mestre do estúdio nada respondeu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，不管敲了多久的門，書房的主人就是不給予回應。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，不管敲了多久的门，书房的主人就是不给予回应。

Umineko Project (UP): Eva and several others said that they should open the door with the second key, the one Genji held.
Steam (ST): Eva and several others said they should open the door with the second key, the one Genji held.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva and several others said that they should open the door with the second key, the one Genji held.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽たちは、源次が持つもう１つの鍵で扉を開けるべきだと主張した。
Russian (RU): Ева и ещё некоторые сказали, что нужно открыть дверь вторым ключом, который у Генджи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eva, acompanhada de alguns dos parentes, disse que eles deveriam abrir a porta com a segunda chave, que estava com Genji.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽等人主張，應當用源次拿著的另一把鑰匙去開門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽等人主张，应当用源次拿着的另一把钥匙去开门。

Umineko Project (UP): However, in a flash of brilliance, Natsuhi said that Kinzo had been in a particularly bad mood and had taken back the key he'd previously given Genji, meaning that he now had both keys himself. She claimed that it was therefore impossible for them to open the door.
Steam (ST): However, in a flash of brilliance, Natsuhi said that Kinzo had been in a particularly bad mood and had taken back the key he'd previously given Genji, which meant that he now had both keys himself. She claimed that this was the reason they couldn't open the door.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, in a flash of brilliance, Natsuhi said that Kinzo had been in a particularly bad mood and had taken back the key he'd previously given Genji, meaning that he now had both keys himself. She claimed that this was the reason they couldn't open the door.
PC Japanese (JP): だが、夏妃は咄嗟の機転で、最近の金蔵は特に機嫌が悪く、源次に持たせていた鍵も取り上げてしまい、今は２本とも、鍵を金蔵自らが持っている、だから扉を開くことが出来ないと言い訳する。
Russian (RU): Однако Нацухи в мгновение ока ответила, что Кинзо был в особенно плохом настроении и забрал обратно ключ, ранее данный Генджи. А значит, оба ключа у него. Поэтому они не могли открыть дверь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, em um instante de brilhantismo, Natsuhi disse que Kinzo não estava com o melhor dos humores e havia tomado para si a chave que Genji carregava consigo, implicando que agora as duas chaves estavam sob a posse dele. Ela então afirmou que era impossível abrir a porta.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，夏妃立即就靈機一動講出了藉口，最近金藏心情特別的糟，沒收了源次帶著的鑰匙，現在兩把鑰匙全由金藏自己帶著，所以沒法開門。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，夏妃立即就灵机一动讲出了借口，最近金藏心情特别的糟，没收了源次带着的钥匙，现在两把钥匙全由金藏自己带着，所以没法开门。

Umineko Project (UP): After she promised to let them meet Kinzo tomorrow morning no matter what, they finally returned to the dining hall.
Steam (ST): After she promised to let them meet Kinzo tomorrow morning no matter what, they finally returned to the dining hall.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After she promised to let them meet Kinzo tomorrow morning no matter what, they finally returned to the dining hall.
PC Japanese (JP): 明日の朝、必ず金蔵に会わせるからと約束し、ようやく食堂に戻ってきたのだ。
Russian (RU): После того как она пообещала завтра утром несмотря ни на что дать им встретиться с Кинзо, они наконец вернулись в столовую.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após jurar aos parentes que eles encontrariam com Kinzo na manhã seguinte, eles finalmente retornaram para a sala de jantar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她保證了，明天早上，一定會讓大家與金藏見面，總算是得以與眾人一同回到了餐廳。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她保证了，明天早上，一定会让大家与金藏见面，总算是得以与众人一同回到了餐厅。

Umineko Project (UP): But, of course, the argument continued on even after they returned there.
Steam (ST): But, of course, the argument continued on even there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But, of course, the argument continued on even after they returned to the dining hall.
PC Japanese (JP): だがもちろん、食堂に戻ってきたからも、罵り合いは収まらない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): だがもちろん、食堂に戻ってきてからも、罵り合いは収まらない。
Russian (RU): Но, конечно же, спор продолжился и после их возвращения туда.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas, é claro, a discussão continuou mesmo depois que retornaram.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過當然，就算回到了餐廳，對罵也不會結束。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过当然，就算回到了餐厅，对骂也不会结束。

Umineko Project (UP): Eva's group wanted a lot of cash very soon, and they were trying to threaten Krauss somehow and make him pay up.
Steam (ST): Eva's group needed a lot of cash very soon, and they were trying to threaten Krauss somehow and make him pay up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eva's group wanted a lot of cash very soon, and they were trying to threaten Krauss somehow and make him pay up.
PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽たちは大量の現金がすぐ欲しく、何とか蔵臼を脅迫して、それを支払わせようとしている。
Russian (RU): Группа Евы хотела быстро получить большую сумму и угрожала Крауссу, пытаясь заставить его выплатить деньги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O grupo de Eva queria pôr a mão no dinheiro o mais rápido possível, e estavam tentando ameaçar Krauss para fazê‐lo pagar de alguma forma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽等人急需大量的現金，使出渾身解數威逼藏臼，逼他付錢。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽等人急需大量的现金，使出浑身解数威逼藏臼，逼他付钱。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Apparently, Battler's solving of the epitaph, which threatened Krauss's position as the next head, had given the others a huge tailwind.
Steam (ST): ...Apparently, Battler solving the epitaph threatened Krauss's position as the Successor, which gave the others a powerful tailwind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Apparently, Battler's solving of the epitaph threatened Krauss's position as the next head, which gave the others a huge tailwind.
PC Japanese (JP): ……戦人が碑文を解いたことにより、蔵臼の次期当主の座を脅かしているのも、大きな追い風のようだった。
Russian (RU): ......Видимо, разгадка Баттлером эпитафии поставила под угрозу позицию Краусса как следующего главы, что дало остальным сильный толчок.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Por ter resolvido o epitáfio, Battler, que agora era uma ameaça à posição de chefe do Krauss, deu aos demais uma condição muito mais favorável.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……戰人解開碑文，從而威脅到藏臼下任當主的寶座一事，貌似是成了陣推波助瀾的強勁順風。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……战人解开碑文，从而威胁到藏臼下任当主的宝座一事，貌似是成了阵推波助澜的强劲顺风。

Umineko Project (UP): On the other side, Krauss and Natsuhi denied the very basis of their argument, claiming that it had never been specified that ownership of the gold would be handed over to the person who solved the epitaph.
Steam (ST): On the other side, Krauss and Natsuhi based their argument on the claim... that it had never been specified that ownership of the gold would be handed over to the person who solved the epitaph.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On the other side, Krauss and Natsuhi based their argument on the claim that it had never been specified that ownership of the gold would be handed over to the person who solved the epitaph.
PC Japanese (JP): 一方の蔵臼と夏妃は、そもそも、碑文の謎を解いた人物に、黄金の所有権が渡るという記述はどこにもないと、話の根底から反論。
Russian (RU): С другой стороны, Краусс и Нацухи основывались на том, что не было указано, будто право собственности на золото перейдёт к разгадавшему эпитафию.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No lado oposto, Krauss e Natsuhi negaram a base do argumento dos demais, afirmando que nunca havia sido especificado que a posse do ouro seria passada para a pessoa que resolvesse o epitáfio.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 另一方的藏臼與夏妃，則是以“說到底，哪都沒有有關將黃金的所有權交給解開碑文之謎的人的記述”，從論點的根基上進行反駁。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 另一方的藏臼与夏妃，则是以“说到底，哪都没有有关将黄金的所有权交给解开碑文之谜的人的记述”，从论点的根基上进行反驳。

Umineko Project (UP): They asserted that it hadn't been hidden gold, but just Kinzo's stockpile, and it was still Kinzo's property, which meant it was only natural for it to be distributed after Kinzo's death with the rest of the inheritance.
Steam (ST): It hadn't been "hidden gold", but simply Kinzo's stockpile, and it was still Kinzo's property, which meant it would naturally be distributed after Kinzo's death with the rest of the inheritance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It hadn't been hidden gold, but just Kinzo's stockpile, and it was still Kinzo's property, which meant it was only natural that it be distributed only after Kinzo's death with the rest of the inheritance.
PC Japanese (JP): あれは隠された黄金ではなく、金蔵が貯蔵したものに過ぎず、今なお、金蔵の所有物であって、その分配は金蔵の死後の遺産分配まで待つのが筋であると主張した。
Russian (RU): Это не скрытое золото, а простые запасы Кинзо, которые до сих пор являются его собственностью, поэтому вполне естественно, что оно будет разделено только после смерти Кинзо, вместе с остальной частью наследства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles afirmaram que não era o ouro escondido, mas sim as reservas de Kinzo, e que ainda era propriedade dele, o que significava que era mais natural que fosse dividido após a morte de Kinzo, junto ao restante da herança.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們主張，那並非是寶藏黃金，僅僅是金藏儲藏著的東西罷了，現今，它依然是金藏的所有物，其分配理應等到金藏死後的遺產分配時再說。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们主张，那并非是宝藏黄金，仅仅是金藏储藏着的东西罢了，现今，它依然是金藏的所有物，其分配理应等到金藏死后的遗产分配时再说。

Umineko Project (UP): After hearing this, Eva's group once again started demanding that they be allowed to see Kinzo.
Steam (ST): Once they made that claim, Eva's group once again started demanding to be allowed to see Kinzo.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): After they claimed this, Eva's group once again started demanding that they be allowed to see Kinzo.
PC Japanese (JP): こう主張すれば、絵羽たちは再び、ならお父様を出せ出せという論法になる。
Russian (RU): Они утверждали это, а группа Евы продолжала настаивать на встрече с ним.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Após ouvirem isso, o grupo de Eva mais uma vez demandou que pudessem se encontrar com Kinzo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這麼一主張，繪羽等人就再次喊起了，“那麼把爸叫出來，把爸叫出來”。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这么一主张，绘羽等人就再次喊起了，“那么把爸叫出来，把爸叫出来”。

Umineko Project (UP): ......It had probably been clear as day from the beginning.{n}This sibling fight could only be settled by Kinzo...
Steam (ST): ...It had probably been obvious to them from the beginning. This sibling fight could only be settled by Kinzo...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It's probably been obvious from the beginning. This sibling fight can only be settled by Kinzo...
PC Japanese (JP): ……最初からわかりきっていることだろう。この兄弟喧嘩は、金蔵にしか収められないのだ…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……最初からわかりきっていることだろう。{n}この兄弟喧嘩は、金蔵にしか収められないのだ…。
Russian (RU): ......С самого начала было ясно.{n}Исход их спора может решить только Кинзо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Já estava claro como o dia desde o início.{n}Esta briga de irmãos só poderia ser resolvida por Kinzo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……從一開始時起就心知肚明吧。{n}這種兄妹吵架，只有金藏能平息…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……从一开始时起就心知肚明吧。{n}这种兄妹吵架，只有金藏能平息…。

Umineko Project (UP): It was obvious that this confrontation was between Eva's group, which wanted cash fast, and Krauss, who was hiding his lack of funds but still didn't need money right away.
Steam (ST): This was obviously a confrontation between Eva's group, which wanted cash fast, and Krauss, who was hiding his lack of funds but still didn't need money right away.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was obvious that this confrontation was between Eva's group, which wanted cash fast, and Krauss, who was hiding his lack of funds but still didn't need money right away.
PC Japanese (JP): すぐに現金が欲しい絵羽たちと、金欠を隠しているが、それでも急ぎの現金を必要としない蔵臼の対決の構図が、鮮明に表れている。
Russian (RU): Очевидно, что это противостояние между группой Евы, желающей быстро получить наличные, и Крауссом, который скрывал недостаток средств, но всё ещё не нуждался в деньгах немедленно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um óbvio confronto entre o grupo de Eva, que queria colocar a mão no dinheiro logo, e Krauss, quem estava escondendo sua falta de dinheiro, mas que ainda não precisava dele imediatamente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鮮明呈現著的是，急著想要現金的繪羽等人，與雖隱瞞著缺錢的事實，但倒也並非急需現金的藏臼對決的構圖。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 鲜明呈现着的是，急着想要现金的绘羽等人，与虽隐瞒着缺钱的事实，但倒也并非急需现金的藏臼对决的构图。

Umineko Project (UP): As Battler listened vaguely to this exchange, ......he marveled at how, despite their usual affluent airs, they were all surprisingly deep in debt...
Steam (ST): As he listened vaguely to this exchange, ...Battler marveled at how, despite their usual affluent airs, they were surprisingly deep in debt...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As he listened vaguely to this exchange, ......Battler marveled at how, despite their usual affluent airs, they were surprisingly deep in debt...
PC Japanese (JP): 戦人はそのやり取りをぼんやりと聞きながら、……普段は金持ちぶってるくせに、みんな案外、借金塗れなんだなと心の中で呆れるのだった…。
Russian (RU): Смутно слушая их разговор...... Баттлер поразился тому, насколько огромные долги у них были несмотря на их привычный богатый вид...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois que Battler ouviu toda a discussão de forma despretensiosa, ......ele ficou surpreso em como, apesar de sempre passarem um ar de afluência, todos estavam afundados em dívidas...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 戰人邊心不在焉地聽著他們爭吵，……邊在心中想著“明明平常擺著副有錢人的樣，其實卻全都令人意外地欠著一屁股債”地大為愕然…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 战人边心不在焉地听着他们争吵，……边在心中想着“明明平常摆着副有钱人的样，其实却全都令人意外地欠着一屁股债”地大为愕然…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "Didn't you already say that a short while ago? That's enough, let's take a break. We're all repeating the same things over and over again."
Steam (ST): "Didn't you say the same thing a short while ago? Enough, let's take a break. We're all repeating the same things over and over again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「それもさっき聞いた話ではないかね。もういい、休止しよう。お互い、一度した話を延々と繰り返しているだけだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それもさっき聞いた話ではないかね。もういい、休止しよう。お互い、一度した話を延々と繰り返しているだけだ」
Russian (RU): "Вы ведь уже говорили это. Достаточно, давайте отдохнём. Мы все снова и снова повторяем одно и то же."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu já não acabei de dizer isso? Já chega, vamos dar um tempo. Só estamos repetindo sempre as mesmas coisas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這不也是剛才聽你們講過的話嘛？夠了，停止吧。我們彼此都只是一直在反反覆覆地講已經講過一次的話罷了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这不也是刚才听你们讲过的话嘛？够了，停止吧。我们彼此都只是一直在反反复复地讲已经讲过一次的话罢了。」

Umineko Project (UP): According to the clock, it was almost midnight.
Steam (ST): According to the clock, it was almost 24:00.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): According to the clock, it was almost 24:00.
PC Japanese (JP): 時計を見上げると、もうじき２４時になるというところだった。
Russian (RU): На часах была почти полночь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De acordo com o relógio, já era quase meia‐noite.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 抬頭看了下鐘，已經快到 24 點了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 抬头看了下钟，已经快到 24 点了。

Umineko Project (UP): It certainly was a perfect time for a break.
Steam (ST): It certainly was a perfect time for a break.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It certainly was a perfect time for a break.
PC Japanese (JP): 確かに、それはちょうどいい、休憩のタイミングに違いない。
Russian (RU): Безусловно, прекрасное время для отдыха.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sem dúvida, era a hora perfeita para uma pausa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 的確，現在這時間一定正好適合稍作休息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 的确，现在这时间一定正好适合稍作休息。

Umineko Project (UP): The atmosphere relaxed just a bit...
Steam (ST): The atmosphere relaxed just a bit...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The atmosphere relaxed just a bit...
PC Japanese (JP): わずかだけ、場の空気が緩んだ…。
Russian (RU): Обстановка немного смягчилась...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A atmosfera no local amenizou um pouco...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此處的氣氛，略微地緩和下來了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此处的气氛，略微地缓和下来了…。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Hideyoshi
Umineko Project (UP): "I agree. It'd do both sides some good to take a breather. ...Listen, why don't we take a record down for the rest. I've had enough of fighting over what was or wasn't said."
Steam (ST): "I agree. It'll be good for both sides to take a breather. ...Hey, why don't we start keepin' a record when we start up again? I'm tired of fightin' over what was or wasn't said."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I agree. It'd do both sides some good to take a breather. ...So, why don't we take a record down for the rest. I've had enough of fighting over what was or wasn't said."
PC Japanese (JP): 「同感や。お互い、一服するのも悪くないで。…ほな、以後は議事を取りながらにせんか。言った言わないはもうゴメンや。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「同感や。お互い、一服するのも悪くないで。…ほな、以後は議事を取りながらにせんか。言った言わないはもうゴメンや」
Russian (RU): "Согласен. Взять перерыв было бы хорошо для обеих сторон. ...Поэтому почему бы нам не записать остальное. С меня хватит споров по поводу того, что было или не было сказано."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu concordo. É bom que ambos os lados saiam para respirar um pouco. ...Ouçam, por que não formalizamos algumas regras de ordem para quando recomeçarmos? Eu já tive o bastante dessa briga sobre o que já foi ou não foi dito."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「同感。彼此都去歇會兒，倒也不壞吶。…對啦，以後要不就邊談邊記吧？可再也受不了去爭“你說了”、“我沒說”了吶。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "Hear that? That's an order from Battler‐sama, successor to the head! Sit over there and have some tea with us. And tell us about what's been going on recently, your hobbies, TV shows you're watching, and whatever it is that's popular with young folks these days. There's a lot we could learn."
Steam (ST): "Hear that? That's an order from Battler-sama, the Successor! Sit over there and have some tea with us. Then you can talk about recent events, your hobbies, TV shows you're watching, and whatever it is that's popular with the kids these days. There's a lot we could learn."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hear that? That's an order from Battler-sama, successor to the head! Sit over there and have some tea with us. Then you can talk about recent events, your hobbies, TV shows you're watching and whatever it is that's popular with young folks these days. There's a lot we could learn."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そら、次期当主の戦人さまのご命令だぞ！　そこに座って、俺たちとしばらくお茶しろぃ。それで、最近の出来事とか趣味とか、見てるテレビとか若者の今の流行りとか、そういう話をしやがれぃ。俺たちの勉強になるからな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そら、次期当主の戦人さまのご命令だぞ！　そこに座って、俺たちとしばらくお茶しろぃ。それで、最近の出来事とか趣味とか、見てるテレビとか若者の今の流行りとか、そういう話をしやがれぃ。俺たちの勉強になるからな」
Russian (RU): "Слышали? Приказ господина Баттлера — преемника главы! Сядьте и выпейте с нами чая. Можете поговорить о недавних событиях, своих хобби, передачах, которые смотрите. О чём угодно, что популярно в нынешнее время у молодёжи. Мы многое могли бы узнать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ouviram? Essa é uma ordem do Battler‐sama, o sucessor do chefe! Sentem‐se e bebam um pouco de chá com a gente. Contem sobre o que tem acontecido recentemente, seus hobbies, programas de TV que acompanham, qualquer coisa que seja popular com os jovens de hoje em dia. Há muito que podemos aprender."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「聽見沒？這可是下任當主，戰人少爺的命令啊！在那坐下，我們來一起喝會兒茶吧。然後再來談談，諸如最近發生了些什麼呀，你們的興趣呀，在看的電視節目呀，年輕人現在流行些什麼呀，之類的話題。畢竟，這些也是會令我們受益的啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「听见没？这可是下任当主，战人少爷的命令啊！在那坐下，我们来一起喝会儿茶吧。然后再来谈谈，诸如最近发生了些什么呀，你们的兴趣呀，在看的电视节目呀，年轻人现在流行些什么呀，之类的话题。毕竟，这些也是会令我们受益的啊。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie

Steam (ST): ......It was like offering your right arm in exchange for your neck being cut.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It was like offering your right arm in exchange for your neck being cut.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É como oferecer seu braço direito para impedir que sua cabeça seja cortada.

Chinese Simplified (CN): ……这就好比是，以送上右臂来换取免于杀头。

Umineko Project (UP): It was probably better than losing your head, but you still might die from the blood loss, and even on the off‐chance that you did survive, you would have to bear a heavy wound that wouldn't heal for the rest of your life......
Steam (ST): It was probably better than losing your head, but you still might die from the blood loss, and even on the off-chance that you did survive, you'd have to bear a heavy wound that wouldn't heal for the rest of your life...

PC Japanese (JP): 首に比べればマシだろうが、失血多量で死ぬかもしれないし、万一、生き残れたとしても、生涯癒せぬ、大きな痛手を背負うことになる……。
Russian (RU): Может, это и лучше, чем потерять шею, но всё равно можно умереть от потери крови. И даже если чудом выживешь, на всю жизнь останется тяжёлая рана.......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Provavelmente é melhor do que perder a cabeça, mas ainda pode acabar morrendo por perder muito sangue, e mesmo que o acaso permita sua sobrevivência, você teria que suportar, por toda a sua vida, uma grave ferida que nunca irá se curar......

Steam (ST): "My apologies. It seems my wife is not at her best, so she's gone to bed early. ......Did something happen? You all seem incredibly flustered."

PC Japanese (JP): 「申し訳ないね。妻は具合が悪そうだったので、先に休ませてもらった。…………何かあったのかね？　何だか諸君がひどく慌しいようだ。」

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Immediately, Genji keenly spotted that which Battler had just put on his finger...

Steam (ST): "Your eyesight's pretty good, Genji-san! ...Looks like you know whose ring this is."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Eheheheheh!! That's right, it's the Ushiromiya family Head's Ring!!

Steam (ST): With half-asleep eyes, I opened my umbrella. The large drops of rain pounded mercilessly against it......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With half-asleep eyes, I opened my umbrella. The large drops of rain pounded against it mercilessly.........

Original Witch Hunt (OG): She cleverly got away by saying that she'd check on Maria, who might have been staying up too late.

Original Witch Hunt (OG): Dad caught me, I missed my chance to escape.........and they made me stick around until now, 3:00 AM...

Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……他們也一定都困了。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): I no longer felt any shock or anger towards them. I guess no painkiller works better than drowsiness...

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 豈止如此，我甚至還聽到了談笑聲……。{n}看來，到這時間，都還有人沒睡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 岂止如此，我甚至还听到了谈笑声……。{n}看来，到这时间，都还有人没睡。

Umineko Project (UP): Despite the late hour, Gohda‐san and Doctor Nanjo were still awake and chatting.
Steam (ST): Despite the late hour, Gohda-san and Doctor Nanjo were still up and chatting.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Despite this late hour, Gohda-san and Doctor Nanjo were still awake and chatting.
PC Japanese (JP): 何と、こんな深夜にもかかわらず、郷田さんと南條先生はまだ起きていて談笑していた。
Russian (RU): Несмотря на поздний час, Года и доктор Нанджо ещё не спали и беседовали друг с другом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apesar da hora, o Gohda‐san e o doutor Nanjo ainda estavam acordados e batendo papo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 哎呀，儘管夜都這麼深了，可鄉田與南條大夫竟還醒著沒睡，談笑風生。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 哎呀，尽管夜都这么深了，可乡田与南条大夫竟还醒着没睡，谈笑风生。

Umineko Project (UP): Plates and cups were lined up on the counter, and it looked almost like a bar with Gohda‐san as the bartender.
Steam (ST): Plates and cups were lined up on the counter, and it looked almost like a bar with Gohda-san as the bartender.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Plates and cups were lined up on the counter, and it looked almost like a bar with Gohda-san as the bartender.
PC Japanese (JP): カウンターにはお皿やコップが並び、さながら、郷田さんがバーテンダーを勤める飲み屋のようだ。
Russian (RU): На столешнице были выстроены в ряд тарелки и чашки, и Года напоминал бармена за барной стойкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pratos e xícaras estavam alinhados no balcão, e parecia até que era um bar, e o Gohda‐san era o bartender.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 櫃台上擺著餐盤與杯子，恰似一間由鄉田擔任酒保的酒吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 柜台上摆着餐盘与杯子，恰似一间由乡田担任酒保的酒吧。

Umineko Project (UP): After noticing I'd come back, it looked as though Doctor Nanjo finally realized how late it was.
Steam (ST): When they noticed I had returned, they seemed to finally realize how late it was.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When they noticed I had returned, they apparently finally realized how late it was.
PC Japanese (JP): 俺が戻ってきたのに気付くと、ようやく今が何時かを自覚したようだった。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Depois de perceberem que eu tinha voltado, parece que o doutor Nanjo finalmente se deu conta de que horas eram.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在看到我回来后，他们貌似总算自我意识到了，现在是几点。

Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Gohda-san made to top off Doctor Nanjo's glass, Doctor Nanjo declined with an exaggerated gesture.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim que o Gohda‐san encheu novamente seu copo, ele recusou com um gesto exagerado.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条大夫以夸张的大幅度动作，拒绝了想要给他的杯子倒满酒的乡田。

Steam (ST): "That's enough, that's enough. ...It's already too late to be up."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's enough, that's enough. ......It's already too late to be up."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......I've had it. I'm tired enough that I might flop over right here...

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……駄目だ。{n}今すぐ、ここで倒れ込みたいくらいに眠い…。
Russian (RU): ......С меня хватит.{n}Я устал настолько, что мог бы уснуть прямо здесь...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Já teria feito isso.{n}Estou tão cansado que poderia cair aqui mesmo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不行了。{n}人都困到，想立即在這躺下了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不行了。{n}人都困到，想立即在这躺下了…。

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Well then, let's call it a night. Don't you have to get up early tomorrow morning to make breakfast, Gohda‐san?"
Steam (ST): "......Well then, let's call it a night. Don't you have to get up early tomorrow morning to make breakfast, Gohda-san?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Well then, let's call it a night. Don't you have to get up early tomorrow morning to make breakfast, Gohda-san?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………さぁ、私たちもこれくらいにしましょう。郷田さんも、明日の朝食の準備で、朝が早いのでしょう？」
Russian (RU): ".........Что ж, давайте на этом закончим. Вам же завтра рано утром готовить завтрак, да, Года?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Muito bem, vamos encerrar por hoje. Você não precisa acordar cedo para preparar o café da manhã, Gohda‐san?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………我們就到此為止吧。鄉田要準備明天的早餐，早上是得早起吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………我们就到此为止吧。乡田要准备明天的早餐，早上是得早起吧？」

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Preparations for breakfast have already been made. As always, I have full confidence that you will enjoy it greatly, so please look forward to it."
Steam (ST): "Preparations for breakfast have already been made. I would be most pleased if you look forward to it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Preparations for breakfast have already been made. I would be most pleased if you look forward to tomorrow's breakfast."
PC Japanese (JP): 「朝食の仕込みはすでに済んでおります。どうぞ明日の朝食も、大いにご期待いただければ幸いです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「朝食の仕込みはすでに済んでおります。どうぞ明日の朝食も、大いにご期待いただければ幸いです」
Russian (RU): "Приготовления к завтраку уже завершены. Надеюсь, вы с нетерпением будете его ждать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Os preparativos para o café da manhã já estão prontos. Como sempre, estou confiante de que vocês vão adorar, então esperem ansiosos."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「鄙人已經做好了早餐的準備工作。要是能獲諸位對明天的早餐也抱以深深的期待，鄙人將深感榮幸。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「鄙人已经做好了早餐的准备工作。要是能获诸位对明天的早餐也抱以深深的期待，鄙人将深感荣幸。」

Umineko Project (UP): In Gohda‐san's eyes, the family conference is an open stage on which to display his culinary skills.{n}He's probably so pumped up he won't even get sleepy.
Steam (ST): In Gohda-san's eyes, the family conference is an open stage on which to display his culinary skills. Maybe this invigorates him so much that he doesn't even get sleepy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In Gohda-san's eyes, the family conference is an open stage on which to display his culinary skills. Maybe this invigorates him so much that he doesn't even get sleepy.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田さんにとって、親族会議は自分の料理の腕の独壇場だ。気力が充実して、眠くさえもならないのだろう。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 郷田さんにとって、親族会議は自分の料理の腕の独壇場だ。{n}気力が充実して、眠くさえもならないのだろう。
Russian (RU): В глазах Годы семейное собрание — открытая сцена для демонстрации кулинарных навыков.{n}Наверное, это так бодрит его, что он даже не чувствует сонливости.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para o Gohda‐san, a conferência familiar era um grande palco onde ele podia exibir suas habilidades culinárias.{n}Ele provavelmente está tão energético que nem está com sono.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對鄉田來說，親族會議是展現自己廚藝的一人舞台。{n}他是幹勁充沛到了，連睡意都沒有了吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对乡田来说，亲族会议是展现自己厨艺的一人舞台。{n}他是干劲充沛到了，连睡意都没有了吧。

Umineko Project (UP): As she laughed at how youthful Gohda was, Erika stood up.{n}This acted as the sign that it was time to disperse.
Steam (ST): Erika stood up, laughing at how youthful Gohda was. This became a sign that it was time to disperse.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika stood up, laughing at how youthful Gohda was. This became a sign that it was time to disperse.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカは、それを若々しいと笑いながら立ち上がる。その起立が、解散の合図となった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ヱリカは、それを若々しいと笑いながら立ち上がる。{n}その起立が、解散の合図となった。
Russian (RU): Эрика встала, смеясь над тем, каким молодым Года выглядел.{n}Это послужило знаком того, что пришло время расходиться.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto ria diante da juventude de Gohda, Erika se levantou.{n}Este ato era o sinal de que havia chegado a hora de se dispersar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花邊因像個小孩子一樣的鄉田而笑，邊站起了身來。{n}她的起立，成為了解散的信號。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花边因像个小孩子一样的乡田而笑，边站起了身来。{n}她的起立，成为了解散的信号。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "I will clean up here. Please enjoy your sleep, everyone."
Steam (ST): "I will clean up here. Please, go and sleep, everyone."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I will clean up here. Please, go and sleep, everyone."
PC Japanese (JP): 「お片付けは私の方でしておきます。どうぞ皆様はお休みを。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「お片付けは私の方でしておきます。どうぞ皆様はお休みを」
Russian (RU): "Я уберусь здесь. Прошу, идите спать."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu irei limpar tudo aqui. Por favor, durmam bem, pessoal."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「鄙人會收拾的。諸位都請去睡吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「鄙人会收拾的。诸位都请去睡吧。」

Umineko Project (UP): Leaving the clean‐up to Gohda‐san, I went to the bathroom and then climbed the stairs to the second floor.
Steam (ST): Leaving the clean-up to Gohda-san, I went to the bathroom and then climbed the stairs to the second floor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Leaving the clean-up to Gohda-san, I went to the bathroom and then climbed the stairs to the second floor.
PC Japanese (JP): 片付けを郷田さんに任せ、俺もトイレに行ってから２階に上がる。
Russian (RU): Оставив уборку Годе, я пошёл в ванную, а затем поднялся на второй этаж.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Deixando a limpeza para o Gohda‐san, eu fui ao banheiro e depois subi as escadas para o segundo andar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把事後收拾交給鄉田，我也去了下廁所，然後上了 2 樓。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把事后收拾交给乡田，我也去了下厕所，然后上了 2 楼。

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "Goodnight, everyone. These old bones have stayed up a little too late."
Steam (ST): "Goodnight, everyone. These old bones have stayed up a little too late."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「それでは皆さん、お休みなさい。老骨には、ちと夜更かしが過ぎましたな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「それでは皆さん、お休みなさい。老骨には、ちと夜更かしが過ぎましたな」
Russian (RU): "Спокойной ночи всем. Мои старые кости работали слишком долго."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Boa noite, pessoal. O idoso aqui já está tempo demais de pé."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「那麼諸位，晚安。以這副老骨頭來講，是有點熬夜熬過頭了吶。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么诸位，晚安。以这副老骨头来讲，是有点熬夜熬过头了呐。」

Speaker: Furudo Erika
Umineko Project (UP): ".........Good night, Doctor Nanjo. Good night, Battler‐san."
Steam (ST): "......Good night, Doctor Nanjo. Good night, Battler-san."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Good night, Doctor Nanjo. Good night, Battler-san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………お休みなさい、南條先生。お休みなさい、戦人さん。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………お休みなさい、南條先生。お休みなさい、戦人さん」
Russian (RU): ".........Спокойной ночи, доктор Нанджо. Спокойной ночи, Баттлер."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Boa noite, Doutor Nanjo. Boa noite, Battler‐san."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………晚安，南條大夫。晚安，戰人。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………晚安，南条大夫。晚安，战人。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Steam (ST): "Yeah. ......G'night..."
Russian (RU): "Да. .........Спокойной..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim. .........Boa noite..."
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Then, in the upstairs hallway, we split up.
Steam (ST): Then, in the second floor hallway, we split up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, in the second floor hallway, we split up.
PC Japanese (JP): そして２階の廊下で、俺たちは解散する。
Russian (RU): И затем — в коридоре на втором этаже — мы разошлись.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, no andar de cima, nós nos separamos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是，我們在 2 樓走廊上解散了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是，我们在 2 楼走廊上解散了。

Umineko Project (UP): Doctor Nanjo went to his own room.
Steam (ST): Doctor Nanjo went to his own room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Doctor Nanjo went to his own room.
PC Japanese (JP): 南條先生は南條先生の部屋へ。
Russian (RU): Доктор Нанджо пошёл в свою комнату.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O doutor Nanjo foi para o seu próprio quarto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 南條大夫去了南條大夫的房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 南条大夫去了南条大夫的房间。

Umineko Project (UP): Erika went to her room.
Steam (ST): Erika went to her room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Erika went to her room.
PC Japanese (JP): ヱリカはヱリカの部屋へ。
Russian (RU): Эрика — в свою.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Erika foi para o quarto dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪梨花去了繪梨花的房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘梨花去了绘梨花的房间。

Umineko Project (UP): And I returned to the cousins' room.
Steam (ST): And I...returned to the cousin room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And I...returned to the cousins' room.
PC Japanese (JP): そして俺は、いとこ部屋へ帰る。
Russian (RU): А я... вернулся в комнату кузенов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E eu retornei para o quarto dos primos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而我回了堂兄妹房間。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而我回了堂兄妹房间。

Umineko Project (UP): I couldn't hear any sounds of playing coming from the cousins' room.
Steam (ST): I couldn't hear any sounds of playing coming from our room.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I couldn't hear any sounds of playing coming from the cousins' room.
PC Japanese (JP): いとこ部屋からは、はしゃぐような声は聞こえない。
Russian (RU): Я не слышал никакой возни из их комнаты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não ouvi nenhum som de brincadeiras vindo do quarto dos primos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 堂兄妹房間中，聽不到玩鬧的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 堂兄妹房间中，听不到玩闹的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Could they have already gone to sleep?{n}No surprise, at this time of night.{n}If they were still playing, they would have been staying up way too late...
Steam (ST): ...Could they have fallen asleep already? No surprise, at this time of night. If they were still playing, they would've been staying up way too late...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Could they have fallen asleep already? No surprise, at this time of night. If they were still playing, they would have been staying up way too late...
PC Japanese (JP): ……ひょっとして、もう眠ってしまったか？無理もない、この時間だ。まだ遊んでたら、さすがに夜更かしが過ぎる…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……ひょっとして、もう眠ってしまったか？{n}無理もない、この時間だ。{n}まだ遊んでたら、さすがに夜更かしが過ぎる…。
Russian (RU): ......Уже уснули?{n}Неудивительно, в такое‐то время.{n}Уже слишком поздно для игр...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......É possível que eles já tenham ido dormir?{n}Não que seja uma surpresa, considerando que horas são.{n}Seria uma surpresa se tivessem ficado jogando até tão tarde...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……大家會不會都已經睡了呢？{n}也難怪，畢竟都這時間了。{n}要是還在玩的話，就實在是熬夜熬過頭了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……大家会不会都已经睡了呢？{n}也难怪，毕竟都这时间了。{n}要是还在玩的话，就实在是熬夜熬过头了…。

Umineko Project (UP): When I opened the door quietly, as expected, the room was already pitch black except for a small nightlight.
Steam (ST): When I opened the door quietly, as expected, the room was already pitch black except for a small nightlight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I opened the door quietly, as expected, the room was already pitch black except for a small nightlight.
PC Japanese (JP): そろりと扉を開くと、案の定、もう真っ暗で豆電球になっていた。
Russian (RU): Когда я тихо открыл дверь, как и ожидалось, в комнате было темным‐темно — горел только маленький ночник.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando abri a porta bem devagar, como esperado, o quarto já estava completamente escuro, com exceção da uma pequena luz noturna.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 靜靜地推開門，不出所料，房中黑漆漆的，只有一點點亮光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 静静地推开门，不出所料，房中黑漆漆的，只有一点点亮光。

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone was already sleeping in their beds.
Steam (ST): Everyone was already sleeping in their beds.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone was already sleeping in their beds.
PC Japanese (JP): みんなベッドの中でとっくに眠っている。
Russian (RU): Все уже спали в своих постелях.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos já estavam dormindo em suas camas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大家早就在床上睡著了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大家早就在床上睡着了。

Umineko Project (UP): I bet they all had a great time horsing around.
Steam (ST): I'm sure they all had a great time and played a ton.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm sure they all had a great time and played a ton.
PC Japanese (JP): さぞやみんな、楽しく遊んではしゃいだんだろうな。
Russian (RU): Наверняка они прекрасно провели время и много играли.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aposto que eles se divertiram muito enquanto brincavam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 想必大家是曾高高興興地玩過、鬧過吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 想必大家是曾高高兴兴地玩过、闹过吧。

Umineko Project (UP): ......They probably had a ton of fun staying up late and talking about their youth.
Steam (ST): ...Then they probably talked about youthful things and enjoyed staying up late.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Then they'd probably talked about youthful things and enjoyed staying up late.
PC Japanese (JP): ……そして、青春を語り合って、夜更かしを楽しんだだろうよ。
Russian (RU): ......Допоздна разговаривали о вещах своего возраста.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Eles provavelmente se divertiram ficando acordados até tarde e conversando sobre juventude.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……探討青春，開開心心地玩到深夜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……探讨青春，开开心心地玩到深夜。

Umineko Project (UP): ......If only I hadn't found the gold, I could have had fun spending time with them...
Steam (ST): ...If only I hadn't found the gold, I could've enjoyed my time with them...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......If only I hadn't found the gold, I could have enjoyed my time with them...
PC Japanese (JP): ……俺も黄金さえ見つけなければ、それに混じって、楽しく過ごせていたのに…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……俺も黄金さえ見つけなければ、それに交じって、楽しく過ごせていたのに…。
Russian (RU): ......Я мог бы провести то время с ними, если бы только не нашёл золото...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Se não tivesse encontrado o ouro, eu poderia ter passado o tempo me divertindo com eles...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我要是沒找著什麼黃金，就也加入其中，度過一段快樂時光了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我要是没找着什么黄金，就也加入其中，度过一段快乐时光了…。

Umineko Project (UP): I'm already...tired......so tired.
Steam (ST): I'm already... tired, ...so tired.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I'm already... tired......so tired.
PC Japanese (JP): もう、眠くて、……眠くて。
Russian (RU): Я уже... устал...... слишком устал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Já estou...cansado......muito cansado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 好、困，……好困。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]

Umineko Project (UP): Forgetting even to change my clothes or brush my teeth, I crawled into bed, .........and immediately started to sink into the marshes of sleep.........
Steam (ST): Forgetting even to change my clothes or brush my teeth, I crawled into bed... ...and immediately began to descend into the marshes of sleep......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Forgetting even to change my clothes or brush my teeth, I crawled into bed, .........and immediately started to fall into the marshes of sleep.........
PC Japanese (JP): 着替えることも歯を磨くことも忘れ、俺はベッドにのっそりと潜り込み、………そのまま眠りの沼に沈んでいく………。
Russian (RU): Забыв даже переодеться и почистить зубы, я забрался в постель......... и сразу же начал погружаться в болото сна.........
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Esquecendo até mesmo de trocar de roupa ou escovar os dentes, eu rastejei para a cama, .........e na mesma hora afundei na marisma dos sonhos.........
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 把換睡衣與刷牙都給忘了，我慢吞吞地爬上床，………就此沉入了眠之沼………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 把换睡衣与刷牙都给忘了，我慢吞吞地爬上床，………就此沉入了眠之沼………。

Umineko Project (UP): Aaah, ......today's been so insane......
Steam (ST): Aaah, ...today's been so insane...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Aaah, ......today's been so insane......
PC Japanese (JP): あぁ、……何て今日はめちゃくちゃな一日だったんだ……。
Russian (RU): A‐a...... сегодня было так безумно......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aaah, ......hoje foi tão intenso......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 啊——，……為什麼今天會是這麼糟糕的一天呢……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 啊——，……为什么今天会是这么糟糕的一天呢……？

Umineko Project (UP): I wonder if that old bastard is still in that family conference now......
Steam (ST): I wonder if that old bastard is still in that family conference now...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I wonder if that old bastard is still in that family conference now......
PC Japanese (JP): クソ親父たちは、今もまだ親族会議を続けてやがるのだろうか……。
Russian (RU): Интересно, мой козёл‐отец ещё на собрании......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Me pergunto se aquele velho desgraçado ainda está na conferência familiar......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 混蛋老爸他們，會不會到現在都還在繼續開著親族會議呢……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 混蛋老爸他们，会不会到现在都还在继续开着亲族会议呢……？

Umineko Project (UP): ......How does he not get tired............?
Steam (ST): ...How does he not get tired.........?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......How does he not get tired............?
PC Japanese (JP): ……よく眠くならないもんだぜ…………。
Russian (RU): ......И как ему не надоело?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Como que ele não se cansa............?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……真虧他們不犯困啊…………。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……真亏他们不犯困啊…………。

Umineko Project (UP): Come to think of it............what was it that old bastard said when we parted company......?
Steam (ST): Come to think of it, ...what was it that old bastard said when we parted company...?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Come to think of it......, ......what was it that old bastard said when we parted company......?
PC Japanese (JP): そう言えば、クソ親父め……、……別れ際に何か言ってなかったっけ……。
Russian (RU): Кстати...... что он там сказал, когда мы расходились?..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Pensando nisso............o que foi mesmo que ele disse quando nós nos separamos......?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 說起來，混蛋老爸……，……在臨別時，好像有跟我講過什麼來著……？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 说起来，混蛋老爸……，……在临别时，好像有跟我讲过什么来着……？

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): — Tomorrow, there's something important I want to talk about, as a family. It's about you.
Steam (ST): 'Tomorrow, there's something important I want to talk about, as a family. It's about you.'
